snippet: Supermarkets are mining the data from their loyalty card programs to adjust prices for and make marketing offers to individual customers.
abstract: Supermarkets are mining the data from their loyalty card programs to adjust prices for and make marketing offers to individual customers; hoping to improve razor-thin profit margins, they are creating specific offers and prices, based on shoppers’ behaviors, that could encourage them to spend more; the pricing model could displace standardized price tags over time; although the use of personal shopping data might raise privacy concerns among retailers are counting on most people accepting the trade-off if it means they get a better price.
lead_paragraph: Supermarkets are mining the data from their loyalty card programs to adjust prices for and make marketing offers to individual customers.

headline.seo: Supermarkets Try Customizing Prices for Shoppers
